content.question: The weight of a population of yeast is given by a differentiable function, <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></math>, where <math alttext="W of t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>W</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> is measured in grams and <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></math> is measured in hours. The weight of the yeast population increases with respect to <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></math> at a rate that is directly proportional to the weight. At time <math alttext="t equals 10" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn></mrow></math> hours, the weight of the yeast is 200 grams and is increasing at the rate of 5 grams per hour. Which of the following is a differential equation that models this situation?

choices.label: <math alttext="W equals, 5 times, open parenthesis, t minus 10, close parenthesis, plus 200" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>W</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>200</mn></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, one half, t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>t</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 1 over 40, end fraction, times W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>W</mi></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, one half, W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>W</mi></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the derivative of W, with respect to t, equals, the fraction 1 over 40, end fraction, times W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>W</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mfrac><mi>W</mi></mrow></math>

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Identify a re-expression of mathematical information presented in a given representation
